availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Richmond, Virginia, merchant. Deerfield, Massachusetts native. Married to Charlotte C. Stebbins. Father of Edwin Augustus Stebbins, Julia U. Stebbins, Charles Stebbins, Jr., Charlotte C. Stebbins, Henry Russell Stebbins, Wilton Pullen Stebbins, and Shirley Brooks Stebbins. Merchant in Richmond, Virginia, in 1850. Employed Benjamin K. Pullen as a merchant in Richmond in 1850. Employed Robert Darracott as a clerk in Richmond in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Richmond in 1850. Merchant in Richmond in 1860. Employed Joseph S. Tyack as a book keeper in Richmond in 1860. Employed four enslaved persons in Richmond in 1860.

ab.bibl:
